snippet: Bryan Huffman, a close friend of the heiress Rachel Mellon, says he thought the donations Ms. Mellon made to John Edwards were strictly to help him become president.
abstract: Bryan Huffman, close friend of elderly heiress Rachel Mellon, takes the stand in the federal trial of John Edwards; Huffman details how he funneled nearly $750,000 from Mellon to Edwards aide Andrew Young, who in turn used the funds to cover up the candidate's extramarital affair. (M)

byline.original: By WILLIAM DUPREE and KIM SEVERSON

lead_paragraph: GREENSBORO, N.C. -- Bryan Huffman, a close friend of the elderly heiress who financed much of John Edwards's attempt to hide an affair, made a grand entry into the federal corruption trial of Mr. Edwards on Thursday. Mr. Huffman, an interior decorator from Monroe, N.C., brought a touch of levity and style to a courtroom that for almost two weeks has been strained by the grim and sometimes plodding details of Mr. Edwards's secret relationship as he sought the 2008 Democratic nomination for president.

headline.main: Go-Between For Heiress Details Link To Edwards
